## GAD-7 vs QIDS-16

Psychologists often seek to compare different mental health assessment instruments, such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Quick Inventory Of Depressive Symptomatology (16-item) (QIDS-16). This process, referred to as harmonisation, can be quite complicated. This is where Harmony comes into play. Harmony, an AI-based tool, allows psychologists and researchers to easily compare and harmonise questionnaire items, including GAD-7 and QIDS-16. Harmony uses advanced technology to match items in different instruments, giving a percentage match between each item. This groundbreaking tool offers seamless integration with Harmony's database or allows you to simply drag and drop your own instruments in PDF format into the web interface. In the case of GAD-7 vs QIDS-16, Harmony can efficiently provide a comparative analysis, saving significant time and reducing subjective interpretations. If you are a researcher or psychologist aiming to compare GAD-7 vs QIDS-16, Harmony could be your perfect solution. It not only aids in comparing items in questionnaire instruments but also in different languages, thereby expanding the scope of comparative research. In this era of data-driven research, Harmony is setting a new standard in psychological research and assessment, making GAD-7 vs QIDS-16 comparison simpler and faster than ever before.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and QIDS-16

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and QIDS-16 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just QIDS-16 into Harmony</a> - compare QIDS-16 with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
